name: Swayable
headline: Swayable predicts consumer opinion and the impact of content
description:
Swayable partners with the world's leading brands and advocacy groups to change minds, behaviors and attitudes.

We are hiring in data science, full stack engineering, data visualization, design, and operations. We welcome unsolicited CVs from anyone, and especially encourage women and people from under-represented groups to talk to us.

founders.name: James Slezak, Founder & CEO
founders.description:
James is Founder and CEO of Swayable.

He was previously Executive Director of Digital Strategy for The New York Times. Before that, he was a founding partner at Purpose.com, a consultant at McKinsey, and co-founded Peers.org, working closely with the founders of Airbnb.

Originally from Australia, James earned a PhD in experimental physics at Cornell, with discoveries published in Science, Nature, and PNAS, and also studied economics under World Bank Chief Economist Kaushik Basu.

generated_description:
Swayable is an innovative company founded in 2018 and nestled in the bustling tech scene of New York City. As a proud member of the Y Combinator Batch W18, Swayable is on a mission to transform the way we understand consumer opinions and the effects of content on behaviors and attitudes. By partnering with some of the world's leading brands and advocacy groups, Swayable seeks to influence minds and shift perspectives in meaningful ways.

With a dynamic team of around 30 employees, Swayable is actively seeking talent across a variety of fields including data science, full stack engineering, data visualization, design, and operations. They have an open door for unsolicited CVs, particularly encouraging women and individuals from under-represented groups to apply. This speaks to Swayableâ€™s commitment to diversity and inclusion in the tech workforce.

Their work revolves around harnessing the power of machine learning, which they use to predict consumer sentiment and gauge the impact of various content strategies. This aligns with their broader goal of enabling clients to make informed decisions based on actionable insights.

If you're intrigued by the intersection of technology and social change, Swayable could be a place for you to explore. For more information, you can visit their website at [swayable.com](http://swayable.com).
